name: Cucumber Raita
history: Cucumber Raita is a traditional Indian side dish, often served as a cooling accompaniment to spicy meals. It combines the freshness of cucumber with the creaminess of yogurt, embodying a balance of flavors typical in Indian cuisine.
description: Cucumber Raita is a refreshing yogurt-based condiment made with grated cucumber, spices, and herbs. It's known for its cooling properties and is often served with biryani, pulao, or as a side with various Indian dishes.

instructions.title: Prepare the Cucumber
instructions.description: Grate the cucumber. Optionally, squeeze out excess water if a thicker raita is desired.

instructions.title: Mix Ingredients
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the whisked yogurt, grated cucumber, cumin powder, red chili powder, salt, and black pepper.

instructions.title: Add Herbs
instructions.description: Stir in the chopped coriander and mint leaves, if using.

instructions.title: Chill and Serve
instructions.description: Refrigerate the raita for a while before serving. Serve chilled as a side dish.

tips: Use fresh, thick yogurt for the best texture and taste.
Adjust the spices according to your preference.
variations: Add grated carrots or beetroot for a colorful variation.
Include a pinch of chaat masala for an extra tangy flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed the same day. Can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl garnished with a mint leaf or cumin seeds.
Accompany with a small spoon for easy serving.
